alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:52PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Butler, Monroe, east central Clarke, southern Wilcox and central Conecuh Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1051 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Pine Apple to 5 miles northwest of Evergreen. Movement was west at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Frisco City, Peterman, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Repton, Yellow Bluff and Pine Apple. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
